data.title: China experts and tycoons to provide advice, ideas to Lee
data.meta_description: Academics, business tycoons, and think-tank members are among 56 people appointed to an expert group formed to provide professional advice a...
data.text:
Academics, business tycoons, and think-tank members are among 56 people appointed to an expert group formed to provide professional advice and new ideas to Chief Executive John Lee Ka-chiu.

The term of appointment will be one year, starting yesterday.

Appointed members of the Chief Executive's Policy Unit Expert Group have been divided into three streams: economic development, social development and strategy study.

Zheng Yongnian - presidential chair professor at Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen, and president of the Institute for International Affairs, Qianhai, who is known as an expert on China issues - is among the appointed members in the research strategy group.

Priscilla Lau Pui-king, a former Hong Kong delegate of the National People's Congress, is also a member of the research strategy group.

She said the group will hold at least two regular meetings during the one-year appointment term, and the Chief Executive's Policy Unit will consult members based on concerned topics from Lee.

Lau said she hopes she can offer her comments on the development of one country, two systems, the city's social and economic development, culture and education.

Lawmaker Chow Man-kong is also a member of the research strategy group.

"I will raise more opinions in aspects like economy and education," Chow said.

He said members like Zheng are renowned for specializing in China development and international relations.

"Under the rising geopolitical tensions, they can provide more helpful opinions to the chief executive, so I think they are all good choices for the expert group," Chow said.

Martin Lee Ka-shing, who chairs Henderson Land, and Adam Kwok Kai-fai, executive director of Sun Hung Kai Properties, are in the economic advancement group.

The president of Our Hong Kong Foundation, Eva Cheng Li Kam-fun, and Lo Wing-hung, publisher of Bastille Post, are in the social development group.

Stephen Wong Yuen-shan, head of the Chief Executive's Policy Unit, welcomed the expert members on board.

"Members of the expert group all have rich experience and professional knowledge in their respective fields, and are eager to offer valuable insights and innovative ideas for the benefit of Hong Kong," Wong said. "In addition to holding regular meetings, the Chief Executive's Policy Unit will also proactively consult relevant members on individual issues."

sophie.hui@singtaonewscorp.com
